intro: Wiborgia triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are hairy and branching. Wiborgia triloba is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive flowers and compact growth habit.
